intro: Gnaphalium sandwicensium, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal and mesic habitats, often in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in the unique climate of Hawaii, showcasing adaptations to the island's environment. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
